subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Utter/Ado
msgSnippet: ... Of course, modern typography can manage SQS fine: it s no more complicated than Arabic, after all.  That will take more than just creating a font; for full
messageBody:
Anthony Grahn scripsit:

> I absolutely, full heartedly agree; junior is the from typographers
> are limited for technical reasons not aesthetic, it is a mere stepping
> stone to something considerably more aesthetically appealing.

Of course, modern typography can manage SQS fine: it's no more complicated
than Arabic, after all. That will take more than just creating a font;
for full generality, the font will have to provide for ligaturing,
and in Windows the Uniscribe DLL (a library shipped with Windows that
understands the issues around layout of various scripts) will have to
be updated. That presumes the assignment of Unicode codepoints.

Alternatively someone can write a QS-specific text editor/ word processor.

--
The first thing you learn in a lawin' family John Cowan
is that there ain't no definite answers cowan@...
to anything. --Calpurnia in To Kill A Mockingbird

Anthony Grahn scripsit:

> I absolutely, full heartedly agree; junior is the from typographers
> are limited for technical reasons not aesthetic, it is a mere stepping
> stone to something considerably more aesthetically appealing. 

Of course, modern typography can manage SQS fine: it's no more complicated
than Arabic, after all.  That will take more than just creating a font;
for full generality, the font will have to provide for ligaturing,
and in Windows the Uniscribe DLL (a library shipped with Windows that
understands the issues around layout of various scripts) will have to
be updated.  That presumes the assignment of Unicode codepoints.

Alternatively someone can write a QS-specific text editor/ word processor.
